intro: Carduus venustus, commonly known as the showy thistle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking purple flowers and spiny leaves, which are typical of the Cichorieae tribe. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, and it is often found in disturbed soils. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
